zone.line: Of dread endurance; from the slippery, steep,
And narrow verge of craglike Agony springs
And folds over the world its healing wings
Gentleness, Virtue,
Virtue & Love & Wisdom & {E}ndurance,--
These are the seals of that most firm assurance
Which bars the pit over Destructions strength;
And if, with infirm hand, Eternity,
Mother of many acts & hours, should free
The serpent that would clasp her with his
length,--
These are the spells by which to reassume
An empire o'er that disentangled Doom
To suffer woes which Hope thinks infinite
To forgive wrongs darker than Death or Night{;}
To defy Power, which seems Omnipotent;
To love, & bear; to hope{} till Hope creates
From its own wreck the thing it contemplates
Neither to change nor falter nor repent
This, like thy glory, Titan! is to be
Good, great & joyous, beautiful & free
